conclusion: Analyze forces acting on bodies A, B, and C using static equilibrium and friction principles.
Body A has weight W_A = mg, normal force F_N,A from ground, frictional force f_A from ground, normal force F_N,AC from body C.
Body B has weight W_B = 2mg, normal force F_N,B from ground, frictional force f_B from ground, normal force F_N,BC from body C.
Body C has weight W_C = mg, normal force F_N,CA from body A, normal force F_N,CB from body B.
For body A, vertical equilibrium: F_N,A = mg + F_N,AC sin θ; horizontal equilibrium: f_A = F_N,AC cos θ.
For body B, vertical equilibrium: F_N,B = 2mg + F_N,BC sin θ; horizontal equilibrium: f_B = F_N,BC cos θ.
For body C, vertical equilibrium: F_N,CA sin θ + F_N,CB sin θ = mg; horizontal equilibrium: F_N,CA cos θ = F_N,CB cos θ.
Angle θ is 30° since bodies are hemispheres and centers form an equilateral triangle.
For body A, calculate normal force: F_N,A = mg + F_N,AC sin 30°; F_N,AC = F_N,CA.
For body B, calculate normal force: F_N,B = 2mg + F_N,BC sin 30°; F_N,BC = F_N,CB.
For body C, calculate normal forces: F_N,CA sin 30° + F_N,CB sin 30° = mg; F_N,CA cos 30° = F_N,CB cos 30°.
From horizontal equilibrium of body C: F_N,CA = F_N,CB.
From vertical equilibrium of body C: 2F_N,CA sin 30° = mg; F_N,CA = mg.
For body A: F_N,A = mg + mg sin 30°; F_N,A = mg + mg * 1/2; F_N,A = 3/2 mg.
For body B: F_N,B = 2mg + mg sin 30°; F_N,B = 2mg + mg * 1/2; F_N,B = 5/2 mg.
For body A, calculate frictional force: f_A = F_N,AC cos 30°; f_A = mg cos 30°; f_A = mg * sqrt(3)/2; f_A = sqrt(3)/2 mg.
